title: B.30 Bowling for Scruples 7: Sorry for Scruplin'
description: The Barone Boys go head-to-head-to-head in another round of the moral quandary-centric and poorly copyedited game of Scruples.

title: B.29 FRANgandhRAYous Bazingsterds: The Nanny 5.18 The Reunion Show
description:
Mike and Adam unpack the epic crossover event that is Ray Barone’s appearance in Season 5, Episode 18 of The Nanny, “The Reunion Show”.
Please go show some love to Diego Brancaccio’s piano cover of The Nanny theme song.

title: B.28 BarONUS pre-shOwNUS, Vol. 3
description: Another compilation of pre-show chats from 4.10, 4.17, B.24, and B.27, plus two deleted scenes from 4.12.

title: B.27 The HefferMen: KoQ 1.9 Road Rayge
description:
Adam and Mike break down the epic crossover event that is Season 1 Episode 9 of the King of Queens, “Road Rayge.”
Some notes:
Jacob Neufeld’s beautiful rendition of the King of Queens theme song


Even More Shameless Crossover Monday

The International Prototype of the Kilogram

title: B.26 The gRAYt’Til Deadth: 1.16 The Italian Affair
description: Adam and Mike break down Ray Romano’s cameo in Season 1, Episode 16 of the Brad Garrett sitcom ’Til Death, “The Italian Affair.”

title: B.25 Bowling for Scruples 6: The Great Scruples ELECTION Case (or, Scru Plethedrals)
description: The Barone Boys play another round of America’s favorite moral quandary-centric card game, and also react to the 2024 election’s big October surprise: Kamala Harris talking about Scruples.

title: B.24 Who Wants to Be a M(ar)i(e)llionaire?
description: Adam and Mike discuss Ray Romano and Brad Garrett’s joint appearance on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? before Mike attempts to answer the same questions.

title: B.23 BarONUS pre-shOwNUS, Vol. 2
description: A new compilation of pre-show chats from the second half of season 3 and the start of season 4.

title: B.22 Bowling for Scruples 5: A Hangover You Don't D'Scruple
description: The Barone Boys administer sound spankings in another round of Scruples.

title: B.21 RAYnking Season 2
description: The Barone Boys raynk all of the Season 2 episodes in a classic tier list format. See our Season 1 and 2 tier lists here!

title: B.20 Fanfiction Theatre: Everybody Loves Robert
description: Nearly 2 years after reading the first chapter of A Grayer Shade of Gray’s Everybody Loves Robert on our episode 1.12, the Barone Boys bring the saga to a close…for now.

title: B.19 RAYnking Season 1
description: The Barone Boys raynk all of the Season 1 episodes in a classic tier list format.

title: B.18 BILLY IS BACK
description: Billy Joel is back with his first new single in 17 years! After discussing their anticipation before recording 3.19, Mike and Adam decided to get together as soon as it was released to record an emergency BarONUS review of “Turn the Lights Back On.”

title: B.17 The Middle Men: Luhrmann & Thurman (2.1, 2.17, & 2.24)
description: The Middle Men unpack a couple of very special episodes of The Middle: Season 2, Episodes 1, 17, and 24, featuring Doris Roberts as Ms. Rinsky, Brick’s teacher.

title: B.16 The Middle Men: Wet, White Bread (3.1 & 3.2)
description: The Middle Men tackle Ray Romano’s appearance as Nicky Kohlbrenner in the two-part Season 3 premiere of The Middle.

title: B.15 Banana for Scale / 3.7 Take 1
description: Our first attempt at 3.7 didn’t really have the Barone Boys magic, so we decided to shelve this one - until now! Thanks, editing!

title: B.14 BarONUS pre-shOwNUS, Vol. 1 (3.8, 3.10, & 3.12)
description:
A compilation of our pre-show chats. This edition:
Finding Erdos (3.8): Adam and Mike do some research on Todd Erdos.
The NFL Challenge (3.10): Mike asks Adam to name three active quarterbacks.
Schneider’s Tech Trouble (3.12): The Barone Boys stall as guest Joseph Schneider searches for his headphones.

title: B.13 Somewhere in Mooseport
description: The Barone Boys study Ray’s star turn in “Welcome to Mooseport” (2004).

title: B.12 Ray Ray...Don't Tell Me!
description: Mike G hosts a game inspired by Ray Romano’s May 6, 2023 appearance on NPR’s seminal panel show, Wait Wait…Don’t Tell Me!

title: B.11 Bowling for Scruples 4: Scrupulous Enough to Dance
description: The Barone Boys play their fourth ever round of Scruples.

title: B.10 Bowling for Scruples 3: Let's Do it for Scruples!
description: Still in Jamaica, the Barone Boys careen through another round of Scruples.

title: B.9 Somewhere in Queens
description: From Jamaica (and not the one in Queens), the Barone Boys wax poetic about Ray Romano’s new film Somewhere in Queens.

title: B.8 Bowling for Scruples 2: Rock on Scrupulous Ones!!
description: The Barone Boys play a second rousing round of Scruples.

title: B.7 Love Raymond or List Raymond
description: Two young professionals look for a house that is walking distance to the beach, close to the city center, and is (or was formerly) owned by Ray Romano. Here’s Ray’s Venice farmhouse, his Toluca Lake fixer-upper, and the article about his Malibu beach house!

title: B.6 CelebRAYty JeopRAYdy!
description: The Barone Boys break down Ray Romano’s appearance on Celebrity Jeopardy! and play CelebRAYty JeopRAYdy!

title: B.5 Bowling for Scruples
description: The Barone Boys fill some time with a rousing game of Scruples! Play at home!

title: B.4 Good Morning, Basketball Court: A Judge Debra Story (w/ Khalonji Bulluck)
description: Judge Debra’s back, baby! Adam, Alex, and most-valuable guest Khalonji Bulluck head down to the Lynbrook Sportsplex to adjudicate another classic case: Who would win in a basketball game between Nemo’s Pizza and the Impractical Jokers?

title: B.3 Fanfiction Theatre: The Right Kind of Wrong (w/ Alexa Madison & Joseph Schneider)
description: The Barone Boys and their dear friends present a reading of The Right Kind of Wrong by Patricia Heaton Forever (Debra Barone Barone), published January 21, 2002. This was performed and sound designed exactly as written.

title: B.2 Brad Garrett in Fresh Prince 5.5
description: This Raymembrance was too compelling to cover on 1.17, so the Barone Boys adjourn to their screening room to break down Brad Garrett’s appearance in Season 5, Episode 5 of The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air, along with some talk about attending Will’s performance at the Live 8 concert, Adam’s lawsuit against the producers of The Pursuit of Happyness, cathode ray tubes, and Lynbrook’s Little Ireland. All the important questions are answered: Is Bertha cancelled? How did Jazz know what Fingers looked like? And most critically - will we be dropping Raymond for Fresh Prince?

title: B.1 Good Morning, Night Court: A Judge Debra Story
description: In a case for the ages, Judge Debra must decide if Robert Barone is a superior lawman to Night Court’s Bull Shannon. With nobody involved having seen Night Court ever or at all, the Barone Boys sequester the jury in the Lynbrook Howard Johnson’s to deliberate.
